translated: Verses of the Elders🔽The Collection of Dvādasaka
with deceit and various kinds of work,
and who are harsh and violent,

original: Tepi tattheva kīranti,🔽na hi kammaṁ panassati.🔽Yaṁ karoti naro kammaṁ,
analyzed: te pi tattha iva kīranti  na hi kammam panassati  yam karoti naraḥ kamma
translated: they too are destroyed right there. 🔽For deeds are not lost,
whatever a person does, whether good or bad.
He is the heir of every deed
